commit.message:
xpadneo, core: Handle sync events in xpadneo

To properly sync our multiple sub-devices, we need to synchronize the
input frame in xpadneo instead of the generic HID handler, otherwise
we may see input late or duplicated.

See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/460
See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/pull/282
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

verification.payload:
tree c5eb051f3208f783266eacaa1f3ee84b9275077b
parent d593fa3c452a2e80bd177b0d07091c5393ad1936
author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1709511234 +0100
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1709512356 +0100

xpadneo, core: Handle sync events in xpadneo

To properly sync our multiple sub-devices, we need to synchronize the
input frame in xpadneo instead of the generic HID handler, otherwise
we may see input late or duplicated.

See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/460
See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/pull/282
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message:
xpadneo, core: Remove explicit sync when not needed

Sync is implicitly executed if there have been events on the affected
input device.

Maybe-fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/460
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message: added ff_connect_notify config option to configure.sh

xpadneo, core: Deprecate synthetic rolling axis from triggers

This causes bugs in some applications, seemingly Unity games, and maybe
a few others. This commit introduces a new module parameter
`enable_rolling_axis` defaulting to "disabled", essentially removing
the axis from default installations.

Enabling it will emit a deprecation warning. This is better solved in
user-space. Scheduled for removal after v0.10.

Maybe-affects: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/457
Maybe-affects: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/452
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/385
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/345
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/334
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

verification.payload:
tree c2601799d4d4e47a4f990bdb498da5e2e00ee706
parent 4c90d749b6e8ee5679a1ba9ae032712491289489
author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1707783092 +0100
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1707787069 +0100

xpadneo, core: Deprecate synthetic rolling axis from triggers

This causes bugs in some applications, seemingly Unity games, and maybe
a few others. This commit introduces a new module parameter
`enable_rolling_axis` defaulting to "disabled", essentially removing
the axis from default installations.

Enabling it will emit a deprecation warning. This is better solved in
user-space. Scheduled for removal after v0.10.

Maybe-affects: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/457
Maybe-affects: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/452
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/385
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/345
Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/334
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message:
xpadneo: Support GameSir T4 Cyclone models

These models lack hardware supported haptics like most other third-party
controllers. The Pro models feature trigger rumble, so at least for now
we just allow trigger rumble for non-Pro models, too. It should have no
impact except using some more CPU cycles in the driver.

Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/426
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

verification.payload:
tree 4acaf3ba325d03b2800d29ecb4edb8be41f099f9
parent bce97bd057ce6fcc30bc53a9deb6c0728d31dd1d
author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1707674786 +0100
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1707674786 +0100

xpadneo: Support GameSir T4 Cyclone models

These models lack hardware supported haptics like most other third-party
controllers. The Pro models feature trigger rumble, so at least for now
we just allow trigger rumble for non-Pro models, too. It should have no
impact except using some more CPU cycles in the driver.

Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/426
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message:
Add BUILD_EXCLUSIVE_CONFIG to dkms.conf

Since version 3.0.11 <https://github.com/dell/dkms/pull/269>, dkms
supports the [`BUILD_EXCLUSIVE_CONFIG`] option in dkms.conf to specify
kernel configuration options which must be enabled in the targeted
kernel.  Add this option with `CONFIG_HID`, `CONFIG_INPUT_FF_MEMLESS`,
and `CONFIG_POWER_SUPPLY`, since xpadneo will fail to modpost if any of
these are disabled.  If a user installs a kernel where these options are
disabled, the module will not be built and a warning similar to the
following is printed:

    Warning: The /var/lib/dkms/hid-xpadneo/v0.9-144-g9b3b696-dirty/6.8.0-rc2/x86_64/dkms.conf
    for module hid-xpadneo includes a BUILD_EXCLUSIVE directive
    which does not match this kernel/arch/config.
    This indicates that it should not be built.
    dkms autoinstall on 6.8.0-rc2/x86_64 was skipped for hid-xpadneo

Without this option, the module build would fail and the kernel package
would fail to install, leaving the user with a partially installed
kernel package (on Debian, at least).

[`BUILD_EXCLUSIVE_CONFIG`]: https://github.com/dell/dkms/blob/782bd07641b957012f9b8d621bf9b51f82bfc728/dkms.8.in#L688-L696

Signed-off-by: Kevin Locke <kevin@kevinlocke.name>

Update TROUBLESHOOTING.md

made explicit some additional troubleshooting steps when it comes to Xbox bluetooth failing.

docs(#429): Elite S2 Profiles carry over

See issue #429.

Amend profile switching documentation to state that profiles set to an Xbox Elite Series 2 controller using the Xbox Accessories app will load and operate correctly.
Slots without set configurations inherit the default profile's behavior.

xpadneo, init: Detect HW profile support on current firmwares

This makes it difficult to handle the existence of the Share button,
because all models ship it in the HID bitmap, and we can detect the
presence of HW profiles only late. Take note of that so it doesn't get
missed later when we remap that button because only XBE2 will allow us
to actually unmap it early from the bitmap (because it has a different
PID).

Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

verification.payload:
tree 66e3cbd887ed25e7f9e34f9cbe022fe6f356fedc
parent 292af26f7292507f9e9886ef01f0b6bcf070e928
author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686774983 +0200
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686776846 +0200

xpadneo, init: Detect HW profile support on current firmwares

This makes it difficult to handle the existence of the Share button,
because all models ship it in the HID bitmap, and we can detect the
presence of HW profiles only late. Take note of that so it doesn't get
missed later when we remap that button because only XBE2 will allow us
to actually unmap it early from the bitmap (because it has a different
PID).

Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message:
xpadneo, init: Really exclude the keyboard event from the HID bitmap

With current firmwares, we see a new `KEY_UNKNOWN`, and we also need to
remove the unaliased symbols.

See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/428
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686765992 +0200
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686776846 +0200

xpadneo, init: Really exclude the keyboard event from the HID bitmap

With current firmwares, we see a new `KEY_UNKNOWN`, and we also need to
remove the unaliased symbols.

See-also: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/428
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

commit.message:
xpadneo, hid: Move paddles to range BTN_TRIGGER_HAPPY5

Kernel 6.x seems to use `BTN_TRIGGER_HAPPY5` as the first paddle in the
xpad driver. Let's do the same here so SDL2 can rely on that.

Requires SDL2 2.28 or later.

Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/428
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>

verification.payload:
tree fe4f2e1fbaab30f6dbec5aa6eb69ec0d8821121e
parent 1936c8e489e05e79cc56c3ead0b6979c60df5f47
author Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686704398 +0200
committer Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de> 1686704398 +0200

xpadneo, hid: Move paddles to range BTN_TRIGGER_HAPPY5

Kernel 6.x seems to use `BTN_TRIGGER_HAPPY5` as the first paddle in the
xpad driver. Let's do the same here so SDL2 can rely on that.

Requires SDL2 2.28 or later.

Fixes: https://github.com/atar-axis/xpadneo/issues/428
Signed-off-by: Kai Krakow <kai@kaishome.de>
